isis.stitle: ELECTRICAL SYSTEM TROUBLESHOOTING GUIDE / 2000 4000 and 8000 MODELS BUILT OCTOBER 1, 1998 AND AFTER - ALLISON WT TRANSMISSION WITH WTEC III ELECTRONIC CONTROLS - ELECTRICAL OPERATION

svcsubsecinfo.para: This section describes the electrical operation of the International circuits and components used to connect the transmission to the vehicle electrical system and to the various International installed controls.

The operation description makes reference to connector and wire numbers in describing the system. For the purpose of the description, references will be from the circuit diagrams for the 2000, 4000, and 8000 models.The other models included in this section, the 1000, 3600, 3800 and 4000FBC operate in the same manner, but harness configuration is different and some connector and circuit numbers are different.

note.para: Refer to the Circuit Diagrams for the 2000, 4000 and 8000 models for the following discussions.

svcproc.title: WTEC III ELECTRONIC CONTROL SYSTEM POWER SOURCE
svcproc.para: The WTEC III electronic control system receives battery power at all times and ignition power when the key is on.

BATTERY POWER - Direct battery power from the B+ terminal flows through circuit 14A, 40A MEGA FUSE, circuit 14B, connector (412A), circuit 14B, connector (426), circuits 14B and A336, connector (807), circuit A336, connector (13), circuit 136A, 10A fuse (301), circuit 136, connector (418), and circuit 136B and 136A to ECU connector (632).

IGNITION POWER - With the key switch in start or ignition position, power from the key switch (24) flows through circuit 13J, connector (377), circuit 13M, fuse (301), circuit 146, connector (418) and circuit 146 to a splice. From the splice, power flows through circuit 146C to the backup light relay (639) coil, through circuit 146A to the ECU (634), and through circuit 146E to the neutral indicator relay (962).
The ignition voltage acts as an On/Off switch for the WTEC III ECU and provides ignition power to selected relays located in the rear of the cab.
